intro: Monnina linearifolia, commonly known as slenderleaf monnina, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Monnina linearifolia is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is a hardy species suitable for xeriscaping.
